Instructions: this game is played in turns of three months. You can perform actions by clicking on the buttons to the left. You can also click on elements on the map to inspect and act on them. When you're done for the current turn, click on End Turn to advance time. After 20 years (80 turns) have passed, your final score will be presented.

Credits: Game created by Ricardo Nakamura using Game Maker Studio Professional. Some graphics created using Grafx2. Sound effects created with bfxr. Title music created with Musagi. Audio edited with Audacity. This game uses the Silkscreen font by Jason Kottke.

Information: I first thought about a "gold farm management game" back in 2010 after Jonathan Blow's keynote at SBGames. He spoke of moral responsibilities of game designers, in particular about inducing obsessive behavior in games, and making players perform repetitive chores. It was inevitable to think of "gold farming" as the other side of the coin -- and the game would thematically join the two sides. That game concept then evolved into this implementation.
